metadata.description: Archaeological evidence and sources for 3D Roman fort reconstructions in Greater Manchester
metadata.notes: Reconstructions are schematic interpretations based on archaeological evidence. Actual layouts may have varied.

phases.name: Timber & Turf Fort
phases.construction: Turf ramparts with timber palisade, wooden buildings
evidence: Excavations by Greater Manchester Archaeological Unit (1970s-1980s)
Post-holes and beam slots found beneath stone phase
Turf rampart core identified in section

phases.name: Stone Fort
evidence: Excavated stone foundations visible at Roman Gardens
Wall thickness measured at multiple points

phases.name: Modern Reconstruction
phases.construction: Partial reconstruction of North Gate on original foundations

garrison.evidence: Fort size consistent with auxiliary cohort standard

builder.name: Gnaeus Julius Agricola
builder.context: Northern campaign to consolidate Roman Britain

references.citation: Bryant, S. et al. 'Excavations at Mamucium 1978-1986', Greater Manchester Archaeological Journal

castleshaw.name: Castleshaw

phases.name: Fortlet
phases.construction: Smaller fortlet built within SE corner of abandoned larger fort
evidence: Clear stratigraphic relationship to earlier fort
Smaller garrison post for road patrol

sources: Thompson, F.H. 'Castleshaw: The Archaeology of a Roman Fortlet'

castleshaw.location_context: Controls road from Chester to York through Pennines

references.note: Visible earthworks on site, interpretation panels

phases.name: Agricolan Fort
phases.construction: Turf and timber, later partly rebuilt in stone

latin_name.name: Ardotalia
latin_name.evidence: Ravenna Cosmography (7th century list of Roman places)

garrison.unit: Cohors I Frisiavonum (1st Cohort of Frisians)

references.citation: Conway, R.S. 'Melandra Castle: Being the Report of the Manchester and District Branch of the Classical Association' (1906)

roman_fort_architecture: Johnson, A. 'Roman Forts of the 1st and 2nd centuries AD in Britain and the German Provinces' (1983)

reconstruction_notes.wall_heights: Estimated 4-5m based on typical auxiliary fort standards. No surviving walls to full height in GM.
reconstruction_notes.building_layouts: Based on standard Roman fort plans (principia, praetorium, horrea, barracks). Internal layouts are interpretive.
reconstruction_notes.gate_positions: Four gates standard for auxiliary forts. Exact positions at Mamucium confirmed by excavation.
reconstruction_notes.ditches: Double defensive ditches (fossa) standard. Depth/width from excavated sections.

materials.timber_phase: Oak/ash timbers, turf ramparts, wattle-and-daub buildings
materials.stone_phase: Local sandstone, lime mortar, tile roofs on major buildings
